ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Do you think you had a COVID-19 infection?
On what date did your initial infection with COVID-19 begin? (month)
On what date did your initial infection with COVID-19 begin? (year)
Where did you receive care for COVID-19?
Notes: 0=I stayed at home; 1=I went to the emergency room; 2=I was admitted to the hospital

Do you still feel unwell?
What percentage of your usual state of health (before COVID-19) do you feel? Please choose a number between 0-100%
Are you well enough to work?
Notes: 0=Yes full time; 1=Yes part time; 2=I am not fit to work; 3=I am retired; 4=I am currently unemployed

ElementDescription: Do you feel that your symptoms are improving?
Notes: 1=Week to week; 2=Month to month; 3=Sometimes good or sometimes bad; 4=Absolutely

ElementDescription: Do you have any additional symptoms like feeling sad, depressed, or hopeless?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Some days; 2=More than half the days; 3=Almost every day

ElementDescription: Do you have any additional symptoms like having little interest or not enjoying doing things?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Some days; 2=More than half the days; 3=Almost every day

ElementDescription: Do you have any additional symptoms like feeling alone?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Some days; 2=More than half the days; 3=Almost every day

ElementDescription: Which of the following best describes your experience of breathlessness prior to having COVID-19?
Notes: 1=I have no dyspnea problem unless I exercise a lot; 2=I am short of breath when rushing on flat ground or climbing slopes; 3=I am out of breath in 15 minutes on flat ground or within a radius of 11 meters; 4=I am short of breath to go outside from home or to dress or undress

ElementDescription: Which of the following best describes your experience of breathlessness now?
Notes: 1=I have no dyspnea problem unless I exercise a lot; 2=I am short of breath when rushing on flat ground or climbing slopes; 3=I am out of breath in 15 minutes on flat ground or within a radius of 11 meters; 4=I am short of breath to go out from home or to dress or undress

ElementDescription: How do you feel today about your - Mobility
Notes: 1=I have no trouble getting around; 2=I have mild trouble getting around; 3=I have moderate trouble getting around; 4=I have severe trouble getting around; 5=I can't get around

ElementDescription: How do you feel today about your - Self care
Notes: 1=I have no problems washing or dressing myself; 2=I have mild problems washing or dressing myself; 3=I have moderate problems washing or dressing myself; 4=I have severe problems washing or dressing myself; 5=I am unable to wash or dress myself

ElementDescription: How do you feel today about your - Habitual activities
Notes: 1=I have no problems doing my usual activities; 2=I have mild problems doing my usual activities; 3=I have moderate problems doing my usual activities; 4=I have severe problems doing my usual activities; 5=I am unable to do my usual activities

ElementDescription: How do you feel today about your - Pain / Discomfort
Notes: 1=I have no pain or discomfort; 2=I have mild pain or discomfort; 3=I have moderate pain or discomfort; 4=I have severe pain or discomfort; 5=I have extreme pain or discomfort

ElementDescription: How do you feel today about your - Anxiety / Depression
Notes: 1=I have no anxiety or depression; 2=I have mild anxiety or depression; 3=I have moderate anxiety or depression; 4=I have severe anxiety or depression; 5=I have extreme anxiety or depression

ElementDescription: On a scale of 1 to 100 (where 1 is the worst health you can imagine and 100 is the best health you can imagine), we would like you to tell us how from good to poor your health is today.
Do you feel worse after being active?
If your answer to the previous question is yes, for how long do you feel worse after the activity?
Notes: 1=Less than 1 hour; 2=2-3 hours; 3=4-12 hours; 4=13-24 hours; 5=Greater than 24 hours
